snippet: The more important question for shareholders, though, is whether Pfizer’s chief executive, Ian C. Read, will break up Pfizer.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer’s $5.2 billion offer for Anacor Pharmaceuticals, announced on Monday, dodges the drug giant’s bigger issue. The company may have made a good deal for Anacor, the maker of eczema and toenail-fungus remedies, even though it’s paying a 55 percent premium. The more important question for shareholders, though, is whether Pfizer’s chief executive, Ian C. Read, will break up Pfizer.

headline.main: Pfizer Could Get Its Money’s Worth Out of Anacor Deal
